alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 6:27PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Shelby, eastern Bibb and south central Jefferson Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 626 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ross Bridge to Talladega National Forest. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hoover, Vestavia Hills, Alabaster, Bessemer, Pelham, Helena, Montevallo, Brent, Centreville, Indian Springs Village, West Blocton, Wilton, West Centreville, Bluff Park, Lawley, Ashby, Riverchase, Brierfield Ironworks Park, Patton Creek and Hoover Metropolitan Stadium. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. locally heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
